gpt_critique.critique: Model B's reasoning provides a more comprehensive understanding of the course's impact on SDGs, particularly regarding employment and partnerships.

Quality Education.reason: Model B emphasizes the vocational aspect of the internship, enhancing educational quality.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Model B's focus on employment preparation aligns better with economic growth.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: Model B correctly identifies the partnership aspect of the overseas internship.

gemini_critique.critique: Model B's analysis is more conservative, prompting me to re-evaluate indirect inferences. I agree that some connections were too weak without explicit textual support.

SDG_1 (No Poverty).reason: While internships can lead to employment, the course text lacks explicit mention of poverty reduction, making the original inference too weak.

SDG_10 (Reduced Inequalities).reason: Noticing cultural differences and gaining an international perspective is indirect. The text doesn't explicitly address reducing inequalities.

SDG_17 (Partnerships for the Goals).reason: An 'Overseas Internship' implies collaboration, but the text doesn't specify partnerships for achieving the SDGs, making the link too indirect.
